purpose: The code appears to collect system information including MAC addresses, hostname, and user info, then sends this data to external domains via HTTP requests, potentially for tracking or exfiltration purposes.
flows: MAC addresses collected -> base64 encoded -> sent to remote host
Hostname and user info -> sent to remote host
System network interfaces data -> processed and sent
anomalies: Use of hardcoded C2 domains with .oast suffix suggesting potential command and control infrastructure
Sending system identifiers (MAC, hostname, username) to external servers without user consent
Potential exfiltration of system information over HTTP
analysis: The code collects sensitive system information including MAC addresses, hostname, and user details. It then establishes HTTP connections to known malicious domains (oast.fun, oast-cn.byted-dast.com) with disabled SSL verification. This behavior strongly indicates malicious activity aimed at system surveillance or data exfiltration. The use of base64 encoding and hardcoded domains suggests an attempt to obfuscate the malicious intent.
conclusion: This code exhibits clear signs of malware behavior including system information collection, outbound communication to suspicious domains, and disabling of security features. It's highly likely this is part of a tracking or surveillance tool.
